images.title: Finding safe haven
images.caption: Point Reyes National Seashore, California
images.copyrightonly: © RMB Images/Photography by Robert Bowman/Getty Images
images.desc: This stunning 71,028-acre coastal haven on the Point Reyes Peninsula in Marin County is a gem of the California coastline. Filled with scenic trails that wind through forests and along cliffs, it boasts breathtaking views and lots of wildlife. Point Reyes National Seashore also has a reputation as the most wind-swept spot on the Pacific Coast and the second-foggiest area in North America, so dress accordingly.
